intro: Hura strepens, commonly known as the tropical hura or red hura, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy red bracts that surround its small, yellow flowers. It produces woody capsules that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Hura strepens is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking appearance and ability to thrive in tropical climates.
